name: BEST WESTERN PLUS South Edmonton Inn & Suites

reviews.text: My family and I had a great multi-day stay and this hotel in late June. This was our first time in Edmonton and we chose the hotel primarily due to its affordable rates and the good reviews in Tripadvisor. I must say we weren't disappointed. The room we had was large and more than adequate for a family of two adults and two children. The included breakfast was about as good as you can ever expect with plenty of variety in hot and cold items. Location, though not perfect or ideal, was not too far from anything that Edmonton has to offer if you have a car. We also used the pool and slide a couple of times and that was a lot of fun. All in all, our stay here was very pleasant and I wouldn't hesitate staying here again in the future or recommending it.
reviews.title: Can't Ask for Much More

reviews.text: Our family of 5 stayed for 3 nights at the beginning of July. Our room was very large and well appointed! It was very clean and everything worked perfectly. The location was good, close to shopping and a short hop into the city. We used the pool once and it was very good. The free breakfast was very busy, but the staff did their best to keep it stocked and clean. It was a great way to start the day for free! We didn't have much need to talk to the staff, but that's because everything went just as planned and we didn't encounter any problems! They were very professional on check-in and check-out.
reviews.title: Great new hotel, Great stay!

reviews.text: Travelled to Edmonton for medical reasons. Coming from the North, I was very suprised how friendly everyone was. The staff was very accomodating to me, and helped me move rooms. Very nice hotel.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: I visited this hotel while attending a business meeting in Edmonton. I have always received excellent service but this last visit I felt like royalty. When I arrived, I was greeted as usual by the reception, and while the young lady was looking up my reservation, I was chatting with another young lady, who I found out later was Mandy, the General Manager. My preplanned room was not ready which would not have been a problem but then I was told I was being upgraded. I received my keys and walked up to the door of my room, opened it and went WOW! I was in a room with a jacuzzi, a fireplace, a soft housecoat, and king size bed. It was amazing. I had a great evening, a good sleep and then to top it off got free breakfast and coffee the next morning and my a chariot (Taxi) was waiting to take me to the meeting. I loved it and will definitely go back again as well as refer any one who'll listen. Thanks for making me feel like royalty. It made my day, night and good memories.
reviews.title: Felt like Royalty-

reviews.text: We arrived Canada day (very late) and were pleasantly surprised as this is a very nice hotel, clean quiet. Very comfy beds, nice Simmons World Class beds not the cheap trampoline type you find at other hotels. We thought breakfast was very good with nice selection of food. My kids absolutely loved the water slide and pool.
reviews.title: Nice stay

reviews.text: Very clean, staff are extremely friendly, continental breakfast was awesome! Highly recommend this hotel and will stay here again! Very close to lots of shopping and restaurants and close to Calgary trail
reviews.title: Hidden gem!

reviews.text: I have been staying at this Hotel for the past 6 months due to work and moving to Edmonton. I must say that Mandy and her staff have treated me like royalty. I have never been let down with rooms, parking, breakfast, pool area, exercise room, laundry, computer room or housekeeping. Trust me as I have have used all of these amenties. I have been upgraded almost everytime and will tell everybody of my experience. The Hotel is in a great location and is close to everything I do in the area.
reviews.title: BEST OF BESTWESTERN

reviews.text: I wrote a review las October 2011 about this hotel and it was truly an excellent choice at that time and mentioned that I would stay again when visiting Edomonton. I did last week July 24 - 28, and was not disappointed. The hotel over all is clean, breakfast area staff very attentive, front desk very helpful, and more importantly spacious, clean rooms with all what you need. Location is fine if you don't have business downtown Edmonton. Lots of shopping and restaurants around. The parking lot is always full and could be challenging sometimes to park between 2 cars. Albertans love their trucks.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here one night on a recent trip in Alberta and I wish every night on our trip could have been in a place this nice. This hotel is beautiful. Our room was wonderful. It was spacious and clean. I loved the granite counter tops in the bathroom and in the room. The bathroom was very nice with a wonderf ulshower. The king-size bed was very comfortable. Breakfast was so much better than other hotels. We loved the automatic pancake maker! Everyone was very nice and friendly. I don't know if I will ever make it up to Edmonton again, but I would stay here again if given the chance. We loved this hotel. Stay here!
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.text: This hotel is the jewel of the South. Clean rooms, friendly staff, GREAT hot breakfast included in stay and kids love pool/water slide/hot tub. I have used this hotel while on business and get a great rate and quiet stay. Also have stayed with kids on the week end and although busy we always manage a quiet stay and have a place to sit at breakfast. Beds (mattresses, pillows and blankets) are super comfortable. This hotel is worth the extra five minute drive. There is a new White Spot (family restaurant) across the street and Tim Horten's is within walking distance. The plaza close by has a Shopper's Drug Mart, Taco Bell etc. Many amenities close by. It is a less than five minute drive to the Wal-Mart and South Common shopping district. There is easy access to Anthony Henday which makes traveling anywhere in the city a breeze. No matter what area of the city I need to be in, I always stay here. make sure you sign up for their points membership if you plan to stay often!
reviews.title: Great hotel for business/family

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is located on the south part of Edmonton, so if you don't have a car, this may not be suitable for you. There are Mc Donald’s, A&W and other restaurants just a few minutes away by car.
reviews.title: comfortable stay

reviews.text: The lobby was big and has two waiting areas. The staff was friendly at check in.
reviews.title: Stay Here!

reviews.text: We love the room the minute we entered. The room was huge! There are many spaces for luggage. It was nice to be a spacious room compared to what we had the night before.
reviews.title: Comfortable, Convenient, Good Option

reviews.text: The king size bed was clean and comfortable. A flat screen TV was right in front of the bed. There was a proper working desk and chair next to the TV and a nice leather chair next to the bed. The hotel provides coffee and tea making facility which was located next to the big closet.
reviews.title: beyond expectations

reviews.text: The bathroom was big with bathtub, clean and enough amenities.
reviews.title: Best Beds in the West!!!

reviews.text: The rooms away from the highway are nice and quiet, the suites are spacious and there is a pool and hot tub. The breakfast is better than continental but avoid the sausages, they are just tasteless and greasy. The air conditioner and heater are on strict motion detectors and if you are still for an hour or more (like when you go to bed) it shuts off and the temperature goes to the hotel set limit, I found it too hot in winter and spring visits.
reviews.title: Nice clean rooms, good staff

reviews.text: Stayed here on Canada Day. Here is what happened: Arrived an hour early & had to wait for desk worker to stop watching Euro Cup final to help me...Told our room was not ready and come back around check in time, no problem. Came back at check in time and was given keys to our room (king sized with tub, etc). Went to room and found door propped open and the room was a disaster. Went back down and the wait staff was super flustered. They gave us a double queen with a tub (this was a must with a young child). Went to the room to find out it had a walk in shower..? Went back to desk and after 15 minutes they gave us a business king. Staff was unorganized, unprofessional, etc. Suprisingly loud also! Will not stay here again.
reviews.title: An interesting Experience..

reviews.text: This was our first visit to this hotel and I can truely say that we had a great stay. The rooms were great and the breakfast (which was complimentary) was excellent. We will certainly visit this hotel again. It is easy to get to from South Edmonton Common. It is in a new location and right near the Anthony Henday Freeway.
reviews.title: One of my best experiences

reviews.text: Stayed here during multiple occasions. The hotel is very clean. Breakfast options are decent. The staff are friendly and courteous, when I did not like the room I checked into they immediately gave me another room. Would love to stay there again.
reviews.title: Great Hotel with friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The property is new, convenient to the highway and many other amenities (i.e. good golf courses, many levels of dining and South Edmonton Commons). A vehicle is needed to get around, although there is at least two dinning facilities within walking distance. Of note was the water slide, pool and hot tub area. All were well maintained but the children made so much noise and the cement walls made it very difficult to enjoy the water facility. Normally, we enjoy being around children but these kids and parents were so loud that we left after a few minutes. On the plus side the breakfast fare was better than average, and the breakfast area was very large.
reviews.title: A new facility - great for families

aka: Best Western South Edmonton Inn And Suites
description: Sleek, stylish and contemporary, this Edmonton, Alberta hotel is located close to the city center's most exciting dining and shopping district and features easy access to the Edmonton International Airport and the University of Alberta. The BEST WESTERN PLUS South Edmonton Inn & Suites is in the Top 20% for Quality Assurance Scores for Best Western hotels.This hotel in Edmonton is located just off of Highway 2 and offers spacious, well-appointed guest rooms that feature upgraded amenities - like comfortable pillow top mattresses, an in-room microwave, personal refrigerator, flat screen televisions with cable satellite and free high-speed Internet access. Start each morning at this BEST WESTERN PLUS South Edmonton Inn & Suites with a complimentary full breakfast before heading out to enjoy a swim in our indoor saltwater pool - complete with water slide and hot tub - or break a sweat in our fitness center. This hotel in Edmonton is also 100% non-smoking and Eco-Friendly.
